I've been playing Isaac since 2011 or 2012 (the original of course) and upgraded to rebirth about a year after it released, as well as 100%ing base game, afterbirth, and afterbirth+, so needless to say, I have extensive history with the game and thus am very biased. It's a masterful roguelike, the design is incredibly tight, the music is godly (teehee), and the art goes perfectly with the tone of the game. The replay-ability of this game is genuinely insane.

151049296.review: The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth - a blend of 'aww' moments and 'oh no' horrors, where you navigate Isaac through his basement nightmares with the kind of enthusiasm usually reserved for unearthing fridge leftovers. Each playthrough is like a box of chocolates, except the chocolates are monsters and your mom is trying to end you. It's like a twisted fairy tale with more rogue elements than a sci-fi convention. It's the perfect game for those who enjoy crying in corners, both in-game and in real life. 10/10 would recommend for anyone who thinks their childhood was weird!

When I play The Binding Of Isaac, I feel many emotions. Well, maybe I lied about that.. I primarily feel two! Most of the time I feel like I just bashed my head into a pane of glass, getting the shards all over my face and hands, the glass shredding my teeth and gums. This feeling mainly stems from when I get 0 red hearts as room clear rewards in womb. Sometimes, though, I feel like I just stepped over the border crossing from South Korea to North Korea. The only difference? The gunmen aren't standing as border control, and instead are inside of my room, turning my body into a Tainted Judas run. This feeling typically arises when I die to a floor spike, which is waiting right in front of the door of the next room. 

In conclusion, this is a very good game! I deeply admire this game and hold it to the highest standard of time consuming, Chinese weather balloon fun. Would definitely recommend this to anyone considering it!

Binding of Isaac is one of the beset games ever. This is well known fact, and Afterbirth is an amazing DLC. However, Repentance is one of the biggest let downs ever. Pretty much all top tier items were nerfed, as well as removing for some reason the ability to gain blue hearts from soul fires. Things like Brimstone and Maw still cost 2 hearts but are not worthwhile pickups anymore. Everything is a little harder and the item room rarely has good items for you, and with the introduction of item quality, you'll see them less and less. A big personal sadness is that they nerfed d4, and then stripped The Lost of it. The risk/reward of The Lost holding D4 and spawning with its best possible item made the Lost one of the most unique characters across all games. 

Buy Binding of Isaac. RUN to buy Rebirth. And stop there. You'll be glad you did. 

(There is an absolutely amazing mod for unnerfs and while I'd normally be against modding a game like this, you will find very early on with Afterbirth that if you're going for the new boss, you will have to have a pretty stacked run from start to finish to get there.)

150396889.review:
Rating: ★★★★★ (4.5 Stars)

As a veteran player of the original Binding of Isaac and its flash version, I've followed the evolution of The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth since its release, diving into each DLC with fervor. My journey through these twisted, endlessly varied labyrinths has clocked over 2300 hours, and still, the game's charm hasn't faded. 

Pros:
Diversity in gameplay: Every run feels like a new adventure. The combination of characters, items, and synergies ensures a unique experience every time. It took me over 1000 hours to even begin sensing a hint of redundancy.

Longevity and Replayability: Even now, the game retains its excitement, be it in solo ventures or co-op escapades. The depth of content keeps the gameplay fresh and engaging.

Cons:
Lack of Online Multiplayer: The absence of an online multiplayer mode is a noticeable gap, particularly as the couch co-op can lead to camera cooperation issues. However, there's hope with a beta version on the horizon.

Co-op Play Challenges: The prevalence of small rooms in co-op mode often makes navigation and dodging cumbersome, sometimes to the point of impossibility. A shift towards larger rooms with more formidable enemies could enhance the experience.

Greed Mode's Shortcomings: Greed Mode, while an interesting concept, lacks the sense of reward and progression found in other parts of the game imo. The coin payout feels minimal, and the scarcity of non-coin pickups or chests leaves something to be desired in terms of earning items and upgrades.

Conclusion:
The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth (and all DLC through Repentance) stands as a testament to creative game design, blending dark themes with captivating gameplay that keeps pulling me back in. Its few shortcomings are dwarfed by the vast, engaging world it offers. Whether you're a newcomer to the series or a long-time fan, this game promises an experience filled with discovery, challenge, and endless enjoyment.

150396215.review:
The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth es un juego que realmente me ha encantado. La mezcla de su jugabilidad roguelike con la aleatoriedad de los niveles y la vasta colección de objetos hace que cada partida sea única y emocionante. Este juego no solo es un desafío con su dificultad ajustada y su mecánica de combate, sino que también sobresale por su estilo artístico oscuro y su cautivadora banda sonora.

Lo mejor de Rebirth es su increíble relación calidad-precio. Por un costo bastante accesible, ofrece innumerables horas de entretenimiento, con una rejugabilidad que pocos juegos pueden igualar. He pasado muchísimo tiempo explorando sus profundidades y todavía encuentro cosas nuevas.

En resumen, The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth es una compra obligada para los amantes de los desafíos y los juegos indie. Su combinación de jugabilidad profunda, estilo único y valor económico lo convierten en una joya imperdible en el mundo de los videojuegos.

Isaac and his mother lived alone in a small house on a hill. Isaac kept to himself, drawing pictures, and playing with his toys, as his mom watched christian broadcasts on the television.
Life was simple, and they were both happy. That was until the day Isaac's mom heard a voice from above;
"Your son has become corrupted by sin! He needs to be saved!"
"I will do my best to save him, my lord" his mother replied, Rushing into Isaac's room, removing all that was evil from his life.
Again, the voice called to her; "Isaac's soul is still corrupt! He needs to be cut off from all that is evil in this world, and confess his sins!" "I will follow your instructions lord, I have faith in thee" Isaac's mother replied, as she locked Isaac in his room, away from the evils of the world.
One last time, Isaac's mom heard the voice of god calling to her; "You've done as I've asked, but I still question your devotion to me. To prove your faith, I will ask one more thing of you"
"Yes lord, anything" Isaac's mother begged. "To prove your love and devotion, I require a sacrifice, your son Isaac will be this sacrifice. Go into his room, and end his life as an offering to me to prove you love me above all else"
"Yes lord" she replied, grabbing a butcher's knife from the kitchen.
Isaac, watching through a crack in his door, trembled in fear.
Scrambling around his room to find a hiding place, he noticed a trap door to the basement, hidden under his rug.
Without hesitation, he flung open the hatch, just as his mother burst through his door, and threw himself down, into the unknown depths below.

150075603.review:
This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

You will get numb to how fucked up the actual content of the game is because you'll play it too much. Isaac has almost endless replayability and so much to unlock. The amount of item synergies is incredible. I would give it an edge over other roguelites when it comes to those aspects.
There are certainly a few negative aspects to the game like that it nowadays feels a bit bloated, since there are quite a lot of items and enemies that feel similar to each other. The game design doesn't feel as tight as for example the classic roguelike Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup or Spelunky. But there are definitely a lot of unique items that change the way you play. 
No game in this evergrowing genre feels quite like Isaac and has seen so much support in the form of added content over the years. I think you should definitely check it out if you enjoy other games in the genre and have somehow not tried this one yet.

149934080.review:
The Binding of Isaac has been a true revelation for me in the world of indie gaming. From its quirky, hand-drawn art style to its endlessly engaging gameplay, this roguelike adventure has earned a special place in my heart.

First and foremost, the procedural generation of dungeons ensures that no playthrough is ever dull or repetitive. The excitement of stepping into the unknown with each run is exhilarating, as I navigate through unpredictable layouts, face bizarre enemies, and discover a plethora of unique power-ups that completely transform my playstyle.

The game's art, while initially unsettling, has grown on me over time. Edmund McMillen's distinct style, with its grotesque yet oddly charming characters, creates a visually striking and memorable experience. It's a testament to the game's ability to draw players into its peculiar world, making every encounter and environment feel both strange and fascinating.

The Binding of Isaac's strength lies in its replayability. The sheer variety of items, power-ups, and characters provides an almost endless combination of possibilities. Whether I'm wielding a brimstone laser, summoning a legion of followers, or transforming into a bizarre hybrid creature, each run feels like a unique adventure, keeping me hooked for countless hours.

The game's narrative, though dark and at times cryptic, adds an intriguing layer to the overall experience. Unraveling the story of Isaac and his disturbing journey into the basement adds a touch of mystery and depth, giving me something to ponder even outside of the intense gameplay sessions.

The controls are responsive and intuitive, allowing me to focus on the strategic choices at hand. The difficulty curve strikes a perfect balance, offering a challenge that feels rewarding rather than frustrating. Every victory, especially against the game's tougher bosses, is a triumph that keeps me coming back for more.

The Binding of Isaac's community-driven spirit is evident in its numerous updates and expansions, showcasing the developers' dedication to refining and expanding the game. The ongoing support has not only kept the experience fresh but has also fostered a sense of community among players who share the love for Isaac's twisted universe.

In conclusion, The Binding of Isaac is more than just a game; it's an addictive and endlessly entertaining journey into the unknown. Its unique blend of challenging gameplay, captivating art, and mysterious narrative has made it a staple in my gaming library, and I continue to find joy in its dark and enchanting world with each new playthrough.

149750895.review: Well, this is certainly one of my favourite games ever. I can't stress enough how addicting and good this game is. While there are certain challenges and things in the game that make me want to rip my hair out it was a massive help in me getting better at games in general. The journey this game took me on was one of hardships, determination and success. I spent about a year and a half getting every achievement in this game, and there are so far no games that i've felt the same about since. While many say that the game is heavily dependent on rng and the only way to beat it is with good luck, you need to remember that it really isn't about that. 90% of my runs were mediocre and filled with me finding okay items, but being able to pull through and beat any boss i was going for most of the time. That is to say that luck is certainly a factor, but playing the way i did finding the really good items was always an incredible treat and just added a healthy amount of fun factor my runs. What i suppose i want to say is that if you want to play the game i'd heavily recommend you try to make the msot out of every run, even if the items you get are sub-par you can always make the run good. And even if you fail at the end you at least learned something or became better at the game. It is in those awful slow runs that you actually get good at dodging enemies and min-maxing.

149618261.review:
No considero que sea muy útil reseñar este juego ya que cualquier persona que haya usado steam más de un par de meses lo conoce y sabe bien de que se trata, pero en caso de que necesites alguien que refuerce tu idea acerca de si vale la pena comprar este juego acá estoy.

Este juego vale la pena?
respuesta corta: sí
respuesta intermedia: definitivamente sí
respuesta larga: es sin exagerar uno de los mejores juegos de su década y el máximo exponente de los roguelikes, si te gusta el genero es impensable que no lo tengas/hayas jugado, y si querés iniciarte en el genero este es posiblemente el mejor juego para hacerlo. 
En cuestión de cuanto contenido tiene el juego es innecesario aclarar que tiene muchisimo, ya que los juegos de este género son reconocidos por su extenso contenido y rejugabilidad, pero como jugador de roguelikes puedo asegurarte que el contenido y rejugabilidad de este juego no es igual al resto de roguelikes. El Isaac va más allá de eso, con cada partida es una experiencia totalmente nueva de la otra, tan así que incluso queriendo completar el juego al 100% te vas a entretener, ya que cada personaje tiene sus caracteristicas lo suficientemente distintivas para que las partidas se sientan completamente distintas pero no demasiado diferentes como para que tengas que jugar de una forma totalmente distinta (aunque es cierto que varios personajes cambian la jugabilidad enormemente, lo cual no es nada más que perfecto para experimentar formas de jugar al juego totalmente diferentes de vez en cuando)
Esta reseña la hago en el juego base, pero los dlc's son importantisimos, no porque el juego base sea aburrido o poco jugable, pero la cantidad de contenido que agregan los dlc's es impresionante (diría que 300+ horas de juego).
Me gustaría agregar que la workshop de este juego es increiblemente activa y agrega infinidad de contenido por si lográs completar este juego al 100%, nunca te vas a quedar sin cosas que hacer (sin contar que, a pesar de tener el juego completo, podes jugar partidas normales tranquilamente y te puedo asegurar de que te vas a divertir de igual manera)
asi que sí, vale la pena, incluso diría que es de las mejores compras que se pueden hacer en esta plataforma, corriendo en absolutamente cualquier computadora y funcionando sin necesidad de tener wifi.
El juego tiene puntos negativos? Seguramente, solo que yo no los encuentro, quizas con todos los dlc sea más caro que el juego indie promedio de steam, pero puedo asegurarte que si te gusta el género no hay juego que se le iguale.
Y una ultima cosa, si sos como mucha gente que lo juega/jugó pirata y está pensando en si comprarselo o no hacerlo, puedo asegurarte que poder descargarte el mod que quieras y poder ver tu progreso con los logros de steam vale totalmente la pena, yo tenía un 70% del juego completado en pirata y no dudé en empezar de 0 para disfrutar el juego una vez me lo compré, y no me arrepiento en lo más minimo.
Cuestión, compralo, el the binding of isaac es lo más grande que tenemos como sociedad.

149566114.review: This game is truly one of a kind. you will never have an experience just like Isaac in your life. This very game is like shit served on a cracked silver platter, a refreshing glass of water with bugs in it, a life saving organ transplant from a sketchy homeless man, a comfy bed in a clean room during a house fire, a one question test with 27 required equations, Christmas during a hurricane, having your dreams come true while a crashing plane hurdles towards you, a freshly baked chocolate chip cookie with elephant tranquilizers in it, nearing the finish line in a race and breaking your leg, getting your socks wet while getting a raise at work, having the best day of your life while a meteor strikes earth, getting a new pet cat and having it claw your eyes out, buying a new mirror and walking on a floor of broken glass ................ 12/10 game due to these exact words before your very eyes, play it now!!!

149564394.review:
TBOI one of the best rogue-likes ever made
I always find myself coming back for more saac years after my first purchase, and always unlocking something new. Each run always feels unique and varied, and all the characters have their own special gimmick, some better than others.
It also tackles it's themes very well throughout and most items seem to tie back into them in some shape or form
anyone who doesn't play this game is missing out on a masterpiece
